results.title: Experiment in teaching
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Crabb, James Carr, Department of Education and Science (UK) and World Wide
results.brief_description: A description of new methods of teaching applied science in schools, with particular reference to engineering and technology. The film visits a number of schools including the Technical Activities Centre at Sevenoaks School and Cray Valley Technical High School where practical interest in such projects as making a steam engine, and a go-kart, encourage theoretical study. The common objective of these courses is to develop the pupils’ creative qualities of imaginative thought.

results.title: Experience of cubism
results.brief_description: An attempt to interpret the underlying principles and methods of cubism. The film compares examples of experimental art with objects as we actually see them and shows how the artist continues to draw on nature for the source of their material, but recomposes it for their own specific ends.

results.title: Expedition: New River
results.creator_credit: Michael Perry and Australia and New Zealand School Exploration Society

results.title: Expansion of metals
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Physics in action”.
Covers the expansion of a wire due to increase in heat from electric current: determination of the coefficient of expansion of brass; application of expansion in rails; building constructions and bridges; shrink fitting and expansion fitting of metal couplings. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Expanding math skills with the mini-calculator: introduction
results.creator_credit: Louis Hough, Susan Norton, James M. Smith, Aesop Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Many examples demonstrate how teachers can use mini-calculators to motivate and augment learning, check student work, explore number patterns and sequences, examine decimals, estimate solutions and stimulate mathematical curiosity and creativity. Students are shown in class and on field trips as they solve a variety of problems with the calculator. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Exotic Bali
results.brief_description: An introductory travelogue focusing on the potential tourist attractions that Bali has to offer. Areas included are: Farmlife and market life, cultural ceremonies and way of life, cock fighting, a Balanese funeral procession, cultural ceremonies.
